sectiondef.header: fs_open open and creation mode flags

detaileddescription.para: Open for read flag
Open for write flag
Open for read-write flag combination
Bitmask for read and write flags
Create file if it does not exist
Open/create file for append
Bitmask for open/create flags
Bitmask for open flags
Seek from the beginning of file
Seek from a current position
Seek from the end of file
Flag prevents formatting device if requested file system not found
Flag makes mounted file system read-only
Flag used in pre-defined mount structures that are to be mounted on startup.
This flag has no impact in user-defined mount structures.

Flag requests file system driver to use Disk Access API. When the flag is set to the fs_mount_t.flags prior to fs_mount call, a file system needs to use the Disk Access API, otherwise mount callback for the driver should return -ENOSUP; when the flag is not set the file system driver should use Flash API by default, unless it only supports Disc Access API. When file system will use Disk Access API and the flag is not set, the mount callback for the file system should set the flag on success.

memberdef.name: FSTAB_ENTRY_DT_MOUNT_FLAGS
memberdef.initializer: ((DT_PROP(node_id, automount) ? FS_MOUNT_FLAG_AUTOMOUNT : 0) \ | (DT_PROP(node_id, read_only) ? FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY : 0) \ | (DT_PROP(node_id, no_format) ? FS_MOUNT_FLAG_NO_FORMAT : 0) \ | (DT_PROP(node_id, disk_access) ? FS_MOUNT_FLAG_USE_DISK_ACCESS : 0))

briefdescription.para: The name under which a zephyr,fstab entry mount structure is defined.
Generate a declaration for the externally defined fstab entry.

detaileddescription.para: This will evaluate to the name of a struct fs_mount_t object.
Identifier for file entry
Identifier for directory entry
Identifier for in-tree FatFS file system.
Identifier for in-tree LittleFS file system.
Base identifier for external file systems.

briefdescription.para: Enumeration to uniquely identify file system types.

detaileddescription.para: Zephyr supports in-tree file systems and external ones. Each requires a unique identifier used to register the file system implementation and to associate a mount point with the file system type. This anonymous enum defines global identifiers for the in-tree file systems.

External file systems should be registered using unique identifiers starting at FS_TYPE_EXTERNAL_BASE. It is the responsibility of applications that use external file systems to ensure that these identifiers are unique if multiple file system implementations are used by the application.
Initializes the fs_file_t object; the function needs to be invoked on object before first use with fs_open.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to file object

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the fs_dir_t object; the function needs to be invoked on object before first use with fs_opendir.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to file object

detaileddescription.para: Opens or possibly creates a file and associates a stream with it.

flags can be 0 or a binary combination of one or more of the following identifiers:
FS_O_READ open for read
FS_O_WRITE open for write
FS_O_RDWR open for read/write (FS_O_READ | FS_O_WRITE)
FS_O_CREATE create file if it does not exist
FS_O_APPEND move to end of file before each write
If flags are set to 0 the function will attempt to open an existing file with no read/write access; this may be used to e.g. check if the file exists.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a file object
The name of a file to open
The mode flags
on success;
when zfp is already used;
when a bad file name is given;
when opening read-only file for write, or attempting to create a file on a system that has been mounted with the FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY flag;
when the file path is not possible (bad mount point);
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code, depending on a file system back-end.

detaileddescription.para: Flushes the associated stream and closes the file.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the file object
on success;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
a negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the specified file or directory

parameterdescription.para: Path to the file or directory to delete
on success;
when a bad file name is given;
if file is read-only, or when file system has been mounted with the FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY flag;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para:
Performs a rename and / or move of the specified source path to the specified destination. The source path can refer to either a file or a directory. All intermediate directories in the destination path must already exist. If the source path refers to a file, the destination path must contain a full filename path, rather than just the new parent directory. If an object already exists at the specified destination path, this function causes it to be unlinked prior to the rename (i.e., the destination gets clobbered).
Current implementation does not allow moving files between mount points.
from
The source path
to
The destination path
0
on success;
-EINVAL
when a bad file name is given, or when rename would cause move between mount points;
-EROFS
if file is read-only, or when file system has been mounted with the FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY flag;
-ENOTSUP
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
<0
an other negative errno code on error.
Reads up to size bytes of data to ptr pointed buffer, returns number of bytes read. A returned value may be lower than size if there were fewer bytes available than requested.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the file object
Pointer to the data buffer
Number of bytes to be read
a number of bytes read, on success;
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
a negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to write size number of bytes to the specified file. If a negative value is returned from the function, the file pointer has not been advanced. If the function returns a non-negative number that is lower than size, the global errno variable should be checked for an error code, as the device may have no free space for data.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the file object
Pointer to the data buffer
Number of bytes to be written
a number of bytes written, on success;
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Moves the file position to a new location in the file. The offset is added to file position based on the whence parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the file object
Relative location to move the file pointer to
on success;
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
if not supported by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves and returns the current position in the file stream.

zfp
Pointer to the file object
>=
0 a current position in file;
-EBADF
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
-ENOTSUP
if not supported by underlying file system driver;
<0
an other negative errno code on error.
The current revision does not validate the file object.

briefdescription.para: Truncate or extend an open file to a given size.

detaileddescription.para: Truncates the file to the new length if it is shorter than the current size of the file. Expands the file if the new length is greater than the current size of the file. The expanded region would be filled with zeroes.

simplesect.para: In the case of expansion, if the volume got full during the expansion process, the function will expand to the maximum possible length and return success. Caller should check if the expanded size matches the requested length.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the file object
New size of the file in bytes
on success;
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

briefdescription.para: Flush cached write data buffers of an open file.

detaileddescription.para:
The function flushes the cache of an open file; it can be invoked to ensure data gets written to the storage media immediately, e.g. to avoid data loss in case if power is removed unexpectedly.
Closing a file will cause caches to be flushed correctly so the function need not be called when the file is being closed.
zfp
Pointer to the file object
0
on success;
-EBADF
when invoked on zfp that represents unopened/closed file;
-ENOTSUP
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
<0
a negative errno code on error.
Creates a new directory using specified path.

parameterdescription.para: Path to the directory to create
on success;
if file is read-only, or when file system has been mounted with the FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY flag;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error

detaileddescription.para: Opens an existing directory specified by the path.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the directory object
Path to the directory to open
on success;
when a bad directory path is given;
when zdp is already used;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
a negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Reads directory entries of an open directory. In end-of-dir condition, the function will return 0 and set the entry->name[0] to 0.

simplesect.para: : Most existing underlying file systems do not generate POSIX special directory entries "." or "..". For consistency the abstraction layer will remove these from lower layer results so higher layers see consistent results.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the directory object
Pointer to zfs_dirent structure to read the entry into
on success or end-of-dir;
when no such directory found;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
a negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Closes an open directory.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the directory object
on success;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
a negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Perform steps needed for mounting a file system like calling the file system specific mount function and adding the mount point to mounted file system list.

simplesect.para: Current implementation of ELM FAT driver allows only following mount points: "/RAM:","/NAND:","/CF:","/SD:","/SD2:","/USB:","/USB2:","/USB3:" or mount points that consist of single digit, e.g: "/0:", "/1:" and so forth.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the fs_mount_t structure. Referenced object is not changed if the mount operation failed. A reference is captured in the fs infrastructure if the mount operation succeeds, and the application must not mutate the structure contents until fs_unmount is successfully invoked on the same pointer.
on success;
when file system type has not been registered;
when not supported by underlying file system driver; when FS_MOUNT_FLAG_USE_DISK_ACCESS is set but driver does not support it.
if system requires formatting but FS_MOUNT_FLAG_READ_ONLY has been set;
an other negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Perform steps needed to unmount a file system like calling the file system specific unmount function and removing the mount point from mounted file system list.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the fs_mount_t structure
on success;
if no system has been mounted at given mount point;
when not supported by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

briefdescription.para: Get path of mount point at index.

detaileddescription.para: This function iterates through the list of mount points and returns the directory name of the mount point at the given index. On success index is incremented and name is set to the mount directory name. If a mount point with the given index does not exist, name will be set to NULL.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to mount point index
Pointer to pointer to path name
on success;
if there is no mount point with given index.

detaileddescription.para:
Checks the status of a file or directory specified by the path.
The file on a storage device may not be updated until it is closed.
path
Path to the file or directory
entry
Pointer to the zfs_dirent structure to fill if the file or directory exists.
0
on success;
-EINVAL
when a bad directory or file name is given;
-ENOENT
when no such directory or file is found;
-ENOTSUP
when not supported by underlying file system driver;
<0
negative errno code on error.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves statistics of the file system volume.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the total and available space in the file system volume.

parameterdescription.para: Path to the mounted directory
Pointer to the zfs_statvfs structure to receive the fs statistics.
on success;
when a bad path to a directory, or a file, is given;
when not implemented by underlying file system driver;
an other negative errno code on error.

detaileddescription.para: Register file system with virtual file system. Number of allowed file system types to be registered is controlled with the CONFIG_FILE_SYSTEM_MAX_TYPES Kconfig option.

parameterdescription.para: Type of file system (ex: FS_FATFS)
Pointer to File system
on success;
when a file system of a given type has already been registered;
when there is no space left, in file system registry, to add this file system type.

detaileddescription.para: Unregister file system from virtual file system.

parameterdescription.para: Type of file system (ex: FS_FATFS)
Pointer to File system
on success;
when file system of a given type has not been registered.
